commit_list.message:
Merge pull request #437 from jerefrer/patch-1

Removes long forgotten "debugger" call

Merge pull request #433 from colvint/master

fix snippet options and preview routing errors

Merge pull request #374 from jayzes/snippet-wrapper-class

Allow users to set a wrapperClass option on a snippet for additional wrapper element classes
Add hint in the README about not using the /editor prefix.
Make the modal not a global singleton.
Use travis default notifications strategy.
Add config/routes.rb to files list in gem spec. Fixes #233
replace the current serializeObject jQuery plugin with a nicer one.
Fix execjs error when running the specs under latest build dependencies.

Allow certain button types to provide instances of dialogs instead of just urls.

This will allow people to subclass things like panels to create a more custom panel.
wayward bold font-weight
Make default styles apply to formtastic 2.2 style buttons.
require the buttons css to allow creating buttons outside of forms that match the form styling.
Link to glyphicons

Update the icons for the toolbar and the color theme of the panels.

* Png crush images to optimize their size
* Added the psd to ease creation of new icons.
* Adjust the panel colors and button styles to match the new icon set.
* Update asset build for non-rails distro
Don't need to announce the stout all the time.
Allow loading a new iframe document without reloading the whole editor.

Allow changing the wrapper tag a snippet creates when rendering.

* can pass 'wrapperTag' as a snippet option via the options form.
Oops we don't want travis to treat our cucumber option as a combinatorial ci run
Travis CI build status
Use Cucumber progress formatter in CI
Be a little less specific about height measurements since it is so different between browsers.
get it working with travis
Update read me for updated handling of images backend.

Move images backend into a generator.

* Added cucumber coverage for generators using aruba
* Removed images backend from engine
* Removed paperclip dependency from gem spec

Now that we have a dummy app let's make it more clear where the non-Rails distro is.

* renamed gem public dir to "distro".
* fixed path references throughout Rakefile

Fix the paths for the build task.

* remove redundant html file that now live under spec/dummy

Make mercury more compliant to Rails engines.

* See http://edgeguides.rubyonrails.org/engines.html
* Assets are all under app/ instead of vendor/
* There is a dummy rails app under spec/dummy for dev and testing envs
* Routes use the standard `mount Mercury::Engine => '/'` now
Attempting to run with Travis CI.
Ignore powenv
Latest static build of assets.
Getting cucumber passing again.
Use sprockets-rails for building assets. Issue #210
Precompile mercury_overrides.js. Fixes Issue #192
Get the dev environment working for ruby 1.9.3, bundler 1.1.3, and Rails 3.2.3.
No more TODOs

commit_list.message:
Refactor directional to use visible area of element.

* Used for calculating the best cardinality to position the element relative to it's anchor (container).
* Returns an offset of how far off screen it is so that the element can be repositioned on screen if necessary. This was necessary for pops.
* Allow the rotation of cardinality checks to be provided to set precedence when there are several viable options.

Add hint in the README about not using the /editor prefix.
Make the modal not a global singleton.
Use travis default notifications strategy.
Add config/routes.rb to files list in gem spec. Fixes #233
replace the current serializeObject jQuery plugin with a nicer one.
Fix execjs error when running the specs under latest build dependencies.

Allow certain button types to provide instances of dialogs instead of just urls.

This will allow people to subclass things like panels to create a more custom panel.
wayward bold font-weight
Make default styles apply to formtastic 2.2 style buttons.
require the buttons css to allow creating buttons outside of forms that match the form styling.
Link to glyphicons

Update the icons for the toolbar and the color theme of the panels.

* Png crush images to optimize their size
* Added the psd to ease creation of new icons.
* Adjust the panel colors and button styles to match the new icon set.
* Update asset build for non-rails distro
Don't need to announce the stout all the time.
Allow loading a new iframe document without reloading the whole editor.

Allow changing the wrapper tag a snippet creates when rendering.

* can pass 'wrapperTag' as a snippet option via the options form.
Oops we don't want travis to treat our cucumber option as a combinatorial ci run
Travis CI build status
Use Cucumber progress formatter in CI
Be a little less specific about height measurements since it is so different between browsers.
get it working with travis
Update read me for updated handling of images backend.

Move images backend into a generator.

* Added cucumber coverage for generators using aruba
* Removed images backend from engine
* Removed paperclip dependency from gem spec

Now that we have a dummy app let's make it more clear where the non-Rails distro is.

* renamed gem public dir to "distro".
* fixed path references throughout Rakefile

Fix the paths for the build task.

* remove redundant html file that now live under spec/dummy

Make mercury more compliant to Rails engines.

* See http://edgeguides.rubyonrails.org/engines.html
* Assets are all under app/ instead of vendor/
* There is a dummy rails app under spec/dummy for dev and testing envs
* Routes use the standard `mount Mercury::Engine => '/'` now
Attempting to run with Travis CI.
Ignore powenv
Latest static build of assets.
Getting cucumber passing again.
Use sprockets-rails for building assets. Issue #210
Precompile mercury_overrides.js. Fixes Issue #192
Get the dev environment working for ruby 1.9.3, bundler 1.1.3, and Rails 3.2.3.

commit_list.message: Fix lingering check against old Mercury region type api.

Upgrade to latest Mercury

* Changed region names to match latest in mercury
* Changed html data attributes to match latest mercury
* Added in legacy styles from older versions of mercury
* Updated routes to use put instead of post
Switch add a blank cmsimple.css requires to the mercury_overrides to allow consuming applications to add styles to the Mercury tool bar and associated panels.

Fix for nested form attributes in snippet options.

* Required change of mercury transporting data as json instead of form params.
* Force cast region hashes as hash with indifferent access to be consistent with Rails.

Show the content author that they have unpublished changes.

Add ability to revert to a version of a page.

* Most recently published version is now rendered to public users.
* Authors see the current draft.
* Can view and revert to specific versions for the current draft.
* Refactored pages into front controller and pages to have a separation of concerns between authoring and public rendering of content.
* Extracted page rendering context into page responder for determining the proper state of the page to display.
